results.title: Mechanisms of non-verbal communication in the young child
results.brief_description: Looks at ways in which young children aged from eighteen months to three years communicate with each other, and shows the influence of the home and the mother on the behaviour patterns of children in relation to others.

results.title: Mechanisms of breathing
results.brief_description: The human breathing system in operation. Animated diagrams illustrated the exchange of gases in the lungs and body tissue cells, including pathological conditions. Artificial respiration is demonstrated, and the nervous control of breathing, and factors affecting the rate and depth of respiration.

results.title: Mechanism of the eye (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The eyes of cattle are used as specimens to show the function of each of the structural members of the eye, and in addition a specially designed model lens is used to experimentally show the focusing mechanism of the crystalline lens of the animal eyes

results.title: Mechanism of an organic reaction
results.brief_description: A study of the hydrolysis of an ester, methyl benzoate, shows that the discovery of a reaction mechanism includes a determination of the chemical equation, the structures of the reactants, and the structures of the intermediate molecules.

results.title: Mechanised mining at BHP's Burwood mine
results.creator_credit: Cinesound and Broken Hill Proprietary Company
results.brief_description: Description of methods of mining used at the Burwood mine of BHP, showing how hand-mining has been largely replaced bymechanised methods. Training schemes in the use of modern equipment are illustrated and amenities at the time are shown.

results.title: Mechanised farming [No. 1]
results.brief_description: A general interest film showing various types of mechanical farming equipment being demonstrated in action on a Victorian farm; machinery for mixed light farming predominates. The latter part of this film was made at a demonstration in Gunnedah, NSW, for Federal Ministers of Parliament and Government officials to show that British tractors have ample power to handle the implements used by the average Australian wheat farmer.

results.title: Mechanised farming
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
Illustrates the use of many types of equipment now available to farmers to assist in the production of food for use both in Australia and for export to other countries. Equipment demonstrated includes different types of tractors, ploughs, cultivators, seed drills, ditch-digging equipment, harvesting machines, mechanical and hand spraying equipment for dusting crops and orchards, post-hole borers and power drills for building fences, small bulldozers and so on. Commentary by John Lorimer.

results.title: Mechanised batter stabilzation
results.brief_description: When roads, waterways and railways are made through a cutting, erosion occurs on the banks or batters. The subsoil having been largely removed, grass or other plants will not easily grow. Mechanised equipment is now used to stabilise these batters. First the eroded gullies are eliminated, then a mixture of bitumen and straw mulch applied and finally water, seed and fertilizer sprayed on. The bitumen stabilises the soil, the straw mulch protects the seedlings and pasture regeneration is no longer a problem.

results.title: Mechanisation
results.creator_credit: Video Arts, Peter Robinson, Antony Jay and Michael Latham
results.brief_description: Uses animation and documentary footage to show that as well as specialisation, another way of creating more wealth with the same number of people is through mechanisation. Shows that mechanisation has two forms: (i) finding more energy and (ii) using the energy you already have more efficiently and productively.
